channel.title: Question about Deathcount on PVPScape
channel.description: since ive been using PVPScape I've noticed the deathcounter doesn't count up, i decided today to look at the code of it, it looks right. i don't see anything wrong with the code itself, but yet, it keeps deathcounts at 1, anyone have a solution for this?

item.description:
@Jason_W33D wrote:

nice authority and btw make sure deathcount++; is by al the other voids. and check to see if u messed anything up at the bottom or the top of it.

Read full topic

item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Is there something like deathcount++; in the void called when you die?

Read full topic

item.title: Question about Deathcount on PVPScape
item.dc:creator: @BamBam BamBam
item.description:
@BamBam wrote:

[quote=“Zenzie, post:3, topic:62865”]make sure u have this

characterfile.write(Integer.toString(deathcount), 0, Integer.toString(deathcount).length());

Yea thats there, its in most pking servers, like I said, everything looks correct even with the placement. But yet… It doesn’t count up and shows death count being 1, indicating that the player only has 1 death when on the other hand he doesnt, maybe Lothy will answer my question hopefully… Anyone else that is out there thats willing to help, please do so. I not only prompt you to do so, but I encourage you to do so as well. thanks in advanced.
[br][size=1]Posted on: March 01, 2007, 05:55:58 PM[/size][hr]still seeking help with this if anyones up for it.

Read full topic

item.title: Question about Deathcount on PVPScape
item.dc:creator: @Zenzie Zenzie
item.description:
@Zenzie wrote:

make sure u have this

characterfile.write(Integer.toString(deathcount), 0, Integer.toString(deathcount).length());

somewhere in your source mostly by the other characterfiles

Read full topic
